Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2012 06:41PM StayinAlive68 wrote: What about the bc part?  Isn't there anyone else here who can offer any advice for where I'm at?  Of course my Infectious Disease Doc is involved in this and is working with the oncologist I'm going to see.  She's been working on the slides.  Now for the big appointment.  So much to learn, weigh and decide with all this.  I thought HIV was a sonofa b. I feel very blessed as far as health, I've had no major issues except my numbers dropped below 200 once during a med vacation thus the AIDS diagnosis.  There are lots of side effects I've dealt with over the years with this but it's like you know what your dealing with.  Cancer seems so sneaky.
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with BC. AIDS for 20+yrs. StayinAlive68 Shachar

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2012 08:59PM StayinAlive68 wrote: Good points etherize....so much to digest.  I am kind of attached to my original boobies but just the thought of all that again makes me want to run and hide.
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with BC. AIDS for 20+yrs. StayinAlive68 Shachar

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2012 08:25PM StayinAlive68 wrote: But then I have this looking over my shoulder for the rest of my life.  If I just hack em off it can't get me again.  I have enough I have to deal with on a daily basis.  Getting radiation also can hurt chances of future surgeries?  What if it comes back?  What if I have to go through all of that again?  That is not a ride I want on ever again.  I've already had the suction biopsy thing, then the surgery biopsy which should be called the lumpectomy cause they removed the freakin lump.  Then to clean up margins they call THAT the lumpectomy?  This cancer talk doesn't make much sense so far.
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with BC. AIDS for 20+yrs. StayinAlive68 Shachar

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2012 11:27AM - edited Apr 26, 2012 11:49AM by StayinAlive68 Oh as far as the AIDS, I'll answer it now...my first husband was a hemopheliac.
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with BC. AIDS for 20+yrs. StayinAlive68 Shachar

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2012 12:01PM - edited Apr 26, 2012 12:03PM by StayinAlive68 I cannot go through that again.  The wait.  The surgeries weren't bad.  The radioactive injection before the lumpectomy was absolutly horriffic.  It was the go here get that done, get this done, poked prodded then wait.  Then more poking prodding etc.. and WAIT.  This is seriously a form of torture right?
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with BC. AIDS for 20+yrs. StayinAlive68 Shachar

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2012 08:13PM StayinAlive68 wrote: That's what I'm afraid of...chemo.  I've been sick for the past year with nausea/vomiting and have already lost 70lbs. I've been to so many specialists and they can't seem to figure it out.  As it is I live on Zofran every six hours or I'm puking my guts up.  I can't afford to loose any more weight and the notion of even more nausea/vomiting plus loosing my hair frightens me to the core. So the surgeon said that what I had done was the chemical equivelant to a masectomy.  I don't understand what she means by that this is all so new and surgeons are not well known for big long explanations and hand holding.
